product_name: CetaphilNourishing Oil to Foam Cleanser Face Wash for Sensitive Skin
summary: SummaryHighlightsHSA/FSA eligibleCETAPHIL Nourishing Oil to Foam Cleanser Face Wash for Sensitive Skin nourishes, soothes, and helps strengthen dry to very dry skin
details: DetailsBenefitsBoosts and locks in moisture to tackle drynessInstantly soothes dry uncomfortable skinStrengthens the skin's natural moisture barrierDefends against 5 signs of skin sensitivityDermatologist Recommended for Sensitive SkinHypo-allergenicKey IngredientsPentavitin - helps boost moisture while reinforcing skin barrierFlaxseed Oil - replenishes lipids and soothes skinFormulated WithoutFragranceSulfatesItem 2640165How To UseMassage a small amount onto wet skin. Rinse.IngredientsWater, Glycerin, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Butylene Glycol, Peg-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Lauryl Glucoside, Peg-200 Hydrogenated Glyceryl Palmate, Sodium Cocoamphoacetate, Sodium Cocoyl Alaninate, Sodium Chloride, Peg-150 Pentaerythrityl, Tetrastearate, Citric Acid, Panthenol, Phenoxyethanol, Peg-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Ppg-2 Hydroxyethyl Cocamide, Saccharide Isomerate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Disodium Edta, Linum Usitatissimum (Linseed) Seed Oil, Niacinamide, Pantolactone, Sodium Citrate.
how_to_use: Massage a small amount onto wet skin. Rinse.

reviews.headline: Great for double cleansing, really saw a difference
reviews.comments: I'm always so nervous when trying new skincare because my skin is super sensitive, but this worked wonders for me! My nose gets super oily and breakouts there were painful, but this helped to clear them up when double cleansing.

reviews.headline: Great For Dry Skin
reviews.comments: I have dry, sensitive skin and it's hard to find a cleanser that properly cleanses without stripping my skin and making it feel tight afterward. I also wanted something that doesn't require me to double cleanse. This is it!

reviews.headline: Best 1st Cleanse makeup remover
reviews.comments: I have tried so many different oil cleansers, pre-cleansers, cream cleansers and I have sensitive, oily, acne-prone skin - this stuff is fantastic! Doesn't burn eyes, removes everything without stripping and irritation. Love this!

reviews.headline: Affordable cleanser  for dry, sensitive skin
reviews.comments:
I got this cleanser because I was previously using albolene to remove makeup, then La Roche Posay's toleraine cleanser and it left a film on my face causing breakouts. I wear sunscreen daily, sometimes makeup. I have contact allergies to fragrance and other things, so I'm limited in what I can use. This cleanser does not contain my allergens. It feels like an oil at first, but emulsifies on the skin well and removes the makeup/ sunscreen well. It rinses off easily without leaving a film. My skin doesn't feel dry, tight, or irritated. I like this cleanser. It does the job and it's affordable. 
For reference, I can't use Cerave products because they burn my skin, but this doesn't leave my skin red or burn at all. If you have sensitive or dry skin, this cleanser is worth trying. I am happy with it.

rollup.name: Nourishing Oil to Foam Cleanser Face Wash for Sensitive Skin
